item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Brett Favre signs with Minnesota Vikings
item.description: Brett Favre's latest retirement lasted all of three weeks. The three-time MVP has done an about-face for the second time in as many years and will play for the Vikings this season.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: NFL investigating reports that coach Tom Cable, Randy Hanson of Oakland Raiders in altercation
item.description: The NFL is investigating reports that Oakland Raiders coach Tom Cable got into an altercation that sent one of his assistants to the hospital.

item.dc:creator: Jayson Stark
item.title: Sources: John Smoltz 'strongly leaning' toward signing with St. Louis Cardinals
item.description: John Smoltz is "strongly leaning" toward signing with the Cardinals, two major league sources with direct knowledge of his negotiations told ESPN.com Tuesday night.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Texas Rangers agree to trade with Houston Astros to acquire catcher Ivan Rodriguez
item.description: The Rangers have agreed to trade two minor leaguers to the Houston Astros for Ivan Rodriguez, who was Texas' catcher the last time the franchise made the playoffs in 1999.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Report: Brandon Marshall miffed again with Denver Broncos
item.description: Brandon Marshall has one more reason to be miffed at the Denver Broncos.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Usain Bolt advances to semifinals in 200 meters at world championships
item.description: Looking for his second gold medal of the world championships, Usain Bolt has easily advanced to the semifinals of the 200 meters.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Motion filed to dismiss Ben Roethlisberger lawsuit
item.description: A former Harrah's employee has filed a motion to dismiss a lawsuit that accuses Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback Ben Roethlisberger of raping another worker.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Chicago Blackhawks star Patrick Kane is working on plea deal to avoid charges
item.description: Report: Chicago Blackhawks star Patrick Kane is working on plea deal to avoid charges.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Tennessee Volunteers coach Lane Kiffin says NCAA investigating Bryce Brown's eligibility
item.description: An NCAA representative is investigating whether the amateur status of Tennessee running back Bryce Brown has been violated.

item.dc:creator: David Newton
item.title: Shana Mayfield takes out restraining order against Jeremy Mayfield's stepmom
item.description: The wife of Jeremy Mayfield on Tuesday took out a restraining order against her husband's stepmother .

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Washington Nationals general manager says it is 'very unlikely' Stephen Strasburg will pitch this season
item.description: Acting Nationals general manager Mike Rizzo says it's "very unlikely" newly signed No. 1 draft pick Stephen Strasburg will be called up to the majors this season.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Lance Armstrong, on Twitter, invites Glasgow cyclists along for casual ride
item.description: Lance Armstrong has brought Scottish traffic to a standstill after more than 200 cyclists answered his Twitter invitation for a casual bike ride.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Survivor of NFL boating tragedy wonders why he lived
item.description: The sole survivor of a February boating accident that killed two NFL players and a former college player said he's still haunted daily by "survivor's guilt" and wonders why he was the one who lived.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Detroit Red Wings sign free-agent forward Todd Bertuzzi to one-year contract
item.description: The Red Wings signed free-agent forward Todd Bertuzzi to a one-year contract on Tuesday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: NFL asks appeals court to OK bans for Pat and Kevin Williams
item.description: The NFL asked a federal appeals court Tuesday to clear the way for the suspension of two Minnesota Vikings linemen for violating the league's anti-doping policy.
